assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.en: Part of the course (approx 1/3) is in the form of lectures that give an overview about the topic in general. The lecturers represent different topics and present their own experience in the field. The other part (approx 2/3) is in the form of student presentation / discussion. The presentations / discussions are organized into topics.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give an overview of the field of nanotechnologies and its applications in medicine. The main focus will be in medical applications of nanomaterials, functionalization of nanomaterials and the output as diagnostic devices, contrast agents and drug delivery vehicles.

learning_outcomes.en: Students have theoretical understanding about different subfields and branches in Nanomedicine. Through seminary discussions the students have an overview of various future directions in nanotechnology research.
